metadata.title: CVE-2024-22667 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
Vim before 9.0.2142 has a stack-based buffer overflow becausedid_set_langmap in map.c calls sprintf to write to the error buffer that ispassed down to the option callback functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-22667` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

vim - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-athena - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-gtk - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-gtk3 - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-gui-common - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-nox - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-runtime - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
vim-tiny - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
xxd - 2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: vim package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:8.2.3995-1ubuntu2.16').
